newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks climb off opening lows.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks climb off opening lows.

text.p: U.S. stocks climbed off opening lows in early trade on Wednesday, as technology stocks continued to push higher and blue chip shares mirrored small moves in the bond market.
The Dow Jones Industrial average was down five points at 8182, off lows but hampered by faint weakness in bonds.
The Nasdaq composite was down fractionally at 1622, but its advancing issues slightly outnumbered declining stocks.

"Stocks are putting in an excellent performance given the recent increase in bond yields," Arnold Kaufman, editor of Standard & Poor's Outlook investment advisory newsletter. "There is still strong demand for stocks."
The long bond was down 1/32 to yield 6.49 percent, ahead of a $12 billion 10-year Treasury note auction.

The technology sector digested news Microsoft Corp would invest money in Apple Computer Inc, as well as fourth quarter earnings results from giant computer networking equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc. Cisco's results were below Wall Street's "whisper" numbers.
